purpose: To present the business case for diversity, equity, and inclusion.
title: The business case for Diversity, Equity and Inclusion

bullets.text: Ethnically diverse companies are 36% more likely to outperform less diverse organizations
Gender diverse companies are 25% more likely to outperform less diverse organizations
Employees who perceived that their organization offers both opportunity and fairness are 3x more likely to stay and 3x more likely to recommend it
Of employees of color, 52% will not work for a company that fails to speak out on addressing racial inequality
Employees are 47% more likely to stay with their company when they perceive it to be inclusive
Of global job seekers, 39% have turned down or decided not to pursue a job opportunity because of a perceived lack of inclusion

supporting_facts: Source: Diversity Wins 2020; 2019 Women in the Workplace research; Edelman Trust Barometer 2020
